meanings.definition: To pester or bother someone with complaints or requests.
meanings.sent1: Please don't mither me about doing your chores.
meanings.sent2: She always mithers her brother to play with her.
meanings.sent3: The cat continued to mither the owner for more treats.
meanings.sent4: The rain continued to mither the farmers with its constant downpour.
meanings.sent5: The persistent mosquito would not stop mithering me all night.

meanings.definition: A person who is constantly complaining or worrying.
meanings.sent1: My aunt is such a mither when it comes to family gatherings.
meanings.sent2: The old man down the street is known as the neighborhood mither.
meanings.sent3: The little mither in the office always finds something to complain about.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a mither trapped in a cycle of negativity.
meanings.sent5: The mither at the store always has something to grumble about.

meanings.sent1: Stop mithering over every little detail; it will be fine.
meanings.sent2: She tends to mither about things that are out of her control.
meanings.sent3: The child continued to mither over which toy to pick.
meanings.sent4: The student began to mither about the upcoming test.
meanings.sent5: The bride started to mither about the weather on her wedding day.

meanings.definition: To make a fuss or bother about something.
meanings.sent1: Don't mither over the spilled milk; accidents happen.
meanings.sent2: She tends to mither over every decision, big or small.
meanings.sent3: The manager began to mither about the upcoming project deadline.
meanings.sent4: The child started to mither about not getting the toy he wanted.
meanings.sent5: The customer began to mither about the service at the restaurant.
